about.summary: Software and Embedded Systems Engineer with 10+ years of experience specializing in building AI-augmented embedded platforms for real-time monitoring, predictive analytics, and automation across domains such as industrial IoT, structural health monitoring, and energy systems.
about.extended: I combine deep technical expertise in firmware development (STM32, ESP32, Raspberry Pi) with modern cloud technologies, creating scalable solutions that bridge the gap between hardware and software ecosystems. My work spans the full stack: from sensor signal conditioning and MCU firmware to cloud ingestion pipelines, ML-based analytics, and mobile apps.

caseStudies.title: Multi-Station Earthquake Early Warning System
caseStudies.problem: Izmir needed a city-wide earthquake early warning system that could detect seismic events and trigger automated safety responses (elevator recall, utility shutoffs) within seconds.
caseStudies.constraints: Sub-second detection latency, zero false positives acceptable, heterogeneous station hardware, unreliable network conditions, 24/7 uptime requirement.
caseStudies.architecture: STM32 MCU + ADXL355 accelerometer → SPI → Raspberry Pi gateway → MQTT → Node.js ingestion → RabbitMQ → Python processing → PostgreSQL. Android app for monitoring.
caseStudies.contribution: Designed the full-stack architecture from firmware to cloud. Built the realtime Node.js ingestion layer, Python event detection services, and the early warning broadcast logic. Led firmware development for MCU-Gateway SPI communication.

caseStudies.title: AI-Powered Reverse Vending Machine Fleet
caseStudies.problem: Deploy and operate a fleet of reverse vending machines (RVMs) for recyclable container collection with accurate AI-based container classification.
caseStudies.constraints: Edge inference on GPU with <200ms latency, multiple mechtronics modules to orchestrate, remote fleet management across varied network conditions, regulatory compliance for deposit returns.
caseStudies.architecture: Barcode reader + camera + weight sensors → Edge PC with GPU (YOLO inference) → C++ orchestration layer → Node.js cloud ingestion → Kubernetes-deployed backend on Azure.
caseStudies.contribution: Led the R&D team for end-to-end integration. Built the YOLO inference pipeline, C++ mechatronics orchestration, and established CI/CD with remote debugging capabilities.

caseStudies.title: Solar-Powered Wind Turbine Blade Monitor
caseStudies.problem: Wind farm operators needed a way to detect blade damage early through audio and vibration analysis, avoiding expensive manual inspections.
caseStudies.constraints: Solar-powered with intermittent sunlight, GSM connectivity in remote locations, must survive harsh weather (wind, rain, temperature extremes), continuous audio/vibration capture.
caseStudies.architecture: ESP32 + 4x I2S microphones + accelerometer + environmental sensors → FreeRTOS firmware → SD buffer + GSM/LTE uplink → AWS IoT Core → ML fault detection pipeline.
caseStudies.contribution: Designed full hardware/firmware stack. Implemented FreeRTOS-based audio capture with ring buffers, OTA updates, secure provisioning with TLS client certs, offline buffering for connectivity gaps.

caseStudies.title: Smart Classroom Environmental Monitoring
caseStudies.problem: Research project to monitor and optimize classroom environments for student comfort and energy efficiency.
caseStudies.constraints: Academic budget, need for calibration and reproducibility, multiple sensor types requiring different interfaces.
caseStudies.architecture: Arduino sensor nodes (CO2, light, sound, temp/humidity) → HC-12 wireless → Raspberry Pi aggregator → Python backend → PostgreSQL → Web dashboard.
caseStudies.contribution: Designed sensor node hardware, wrote firmware for multi-sensor data acquisition, built the web dashboard for visualization and data export.
